required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ultrasensitive Electroanatomic Mapping to Adjudicate Endpoints for Ablation In Paroxysmal AF Patients Using Cryoballoon
clinical_study.official_title: Ultrasensitive Electroanatomic Mapping to Adjudicate Endpoints for Ablation In Paroxysmal AF Patients Using Cryoballoon

brief_summary.textblock: Ultrasensitive Electroanatomic Mapping to Adjudicate Endpoints for Ablation In Paroxysmal AF Patients Using Cryoballoon

detailed_description.textblock: Collected data include procedural parameters relevant to pulmonary vein isolation as outlined in the protocol section, DE identified patient demographics, follow up information including rhythm status, antiarrhythmic medication usage, and symptoms or signs to suggest procedural complications relevant to the pulmonary vein isolation procedure.

primary_outcome.measure: Frequency of acute pulmonary vein isolation as adjudicated by pacing catheter based entrance/exit block, and Orion derived activation and voltage map.

secondary_outcome.measure: Procedural endpoints including total procedure time, LA dwell time, total flouro time, total ablation time, and total mapping time.

study_pop.textblock: Patients undergoing pulmonary vein isolation using cryoballoon at St. Joseph's Hospital in FL that sign informed consent

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing pulmonary vein isolation using cryoballoon at St. Joseph's Hospital in FL that sign informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
-
